content.description: Start with a left hand sloper crimp and a right hand gaston. Find a way to get your left up to a vicious sloper and throw up to the jug at the lip and topout
content.location: The right side of the overhang

content.description: I'm sure this has been done before so any info on it would be great. Start matched on giant jug, move to a right hand crimp and left hand sidepull, then bump right hand big to an L shaped jug. Control the swing and then top out
content.location: Left side of the DNA face

content.description:
Start in the huge low jug dish, and move almost straight up to a left hand undercling. Match up and right on a decent sloper, then lunge for a top out jug.

I couldn't figure out for the life of me what the original RNA and DNA routes were based on the "Nut Tree Lite Guide" PDF.  If anyone has better details please feel free to add.
content.location: Left side of the DNA boulder overhanging face

content.description:
A one move eliminate problem. Again, if this has been done before, please let me know so I can update the info!

Start with a left hand on an undercling tooth and a horrible 2 finger right hand v shaped sidepull crimp. Set up and throw left up to the jug at the lip. As far as single moves goes, this felt borderline 7/8, but I haven't really done any single move problems, so feel free to suggest grade changes
content.location: Left of the middle of the DNA face

content.description:
Sit start on the undercling down low and climb straight up from there.

The stand start goes at V8 and starts left hand on the undercling and right hand in a low v-shaped sidecling pocket. Move left hand up to a sloper, then throw for the jugs at the lip
content.location: left hand for barf variation but match it to start
